body:
Trannies come loaded with drama and even gay people - esp. gay men- can't take it.  Trannies make life so difficult and gender fluid may be the worst. I avoid trannies as much as possible.
Also, the males trying to pretend to be females still have high levels of testosterone and so are as physically aggressive as males are and there are many videos showing this. I recently had a fit when my landlord suggested having a gender fluid trannie dude (wanna-be female) move in.  I am moving away from this crazy landlord sooooooon. Men and women are *not* the same creatures and nor should they be.  Androgyny is rather acceptable to me and trying to be a sex you are not when androgyny is such a natural, flexible option just seems ridiculous -- as silly as dressing up your dog or cat.
I resent *anyone* who rejects reality and don't even think lying to kids about the Easter Bunny or Santa Claus or god is a mentally healthy thing to do.
If you can 100% pass as another sex, this trannie thing would almost not even be an issue.  Most males simply cannot pass as females -- no matter how many surgeries or hormones they take. Men have their own beauty (think of the Greek gods and cultures of them) and women do, too.  There is no good reason to hate the sex you were born into -- and it is as mentally damaging as hating your own race (the physical traits, not the cultural traits). Accept the body you were born into and work on making the best of your MIND/BRAIN and take advantage of the body you were born into. Make lemonaide out of lemons -- if you wanna consider your sex as a negative in the first place,

body:
Transgender people are, by definition, delusional. It's a form of body dysmorphia, not unlike body integrity dysphoria, or the mental condition which causes anorexia. The last thing transgenders need is blanket acceptance - they need cognitive behavior therapy in order to accept themselves for who they really are. Sex change operations have not been shown to improve life for transgender people. 

As a side note, though, I don't have any issues with some men acting a little effeminate, or women acting more masculine. My main issues with transgenderism are the complete dismissal of reality and the forced language (pronouns) aspect.
body_html:

As a side note, though, I don't have any issues with some men acting a little effeminate, or women acting more masculine. My main issues with transgenderism are the complete dismissal of reality and the forced language (pronouns) aspect.

post.title: Except if you are an individual's doctor, an individual's natural sex is completely irrelevant to you.

body:
Depends on the dictionary, and depends on who deems that dictionary valid. 


Lets backtrack a bit. What gives a word its meaning? When everyone agrees to it, or at least the people you are speaking to agree to it. So lets go ahead and assume for the sake of argument that gender and sex are different things and that gender has no bearing on reality. In that case no one cares because the definition is too broad, its a nickname at that point. So when they refer to you as a man or woman they speak of your sex. But you're a transgender (not you, just an imaginary person) and don't like being called a man, you want to be a woman. Well what does it mean to be a woman, or a man? These terms are not defined based on imaginary genders but rather on biological realities of both physical and behavioral kind. 


If you are a man that likes men, you are gay not a woman. The reason being that you have an X and Y chromosome, a penis, higher levels of testosterone, increased muscle and bone density, better faculties for navigation, decreased faculties in eyesight, lack of birthing capabilities, etc.


So I ask again, why are they different? Why do they need to be different? But most importantly why does the imaginary gender matter?

If you are a man that likes men, you are gay not a woman. The reason being that you have an X and Y chromosome, a penis, higher levels of testosterone, increased muscle and bone density, better faculties for navigation, decreased faculties in eyesight, lack of birthing capabilities, etc.

body:
I can understand, however what most people that want to "accommodate" that group don't understand is that they don't care about the "nickname" part they care about the man and woman are distinct unchanging categories part. Just look at the Biden executive order to allow men into women sport. When such an old individual is taking part in this you can really tell how mainstream its gotten, considering they don't even know how Facebook works.


This is why there is large amounts of backlash, people don't refuse to say others pronouns, or call them their made up gender because they hate them. They do it because they hate what it represents, and what it represents is critical theories trying to chip away at the very foundations of a country, a culture, and its individuals.


On top of all of that, most folks that wish to be addressed by these made up genders are not sound of mind, you accommodating their "beliefs" amounts to enabling. Enabling someone to do as they please is not the same as caring about them. I suggest you stop "accommodating" their mentally ill wishes.

body: I disagree that it should be, I think this division of half of people from the other half is very unfortunate, especially for males who are naturally disposable and get stuck with all the bad things except having a uterus, but it's a reality that we need to survive. Life was never the dreamland where anything is possible like we were told as kids, but a random, meaningless world of mostly pain and struggling, to some more than others. Some people have everything they want, others don't, and others have everything they don't want. But trying to defy reality will simply create even more problems.

body:
I guess I'll take a stab at explaining my views on this, even tho you've already gotten alot of responses:

Gender = social construct, arbitrary roles that often contradict each other assigned to each sex and rooted in sexism.
Sex = biological. XX or XY. Male or female. 

There is no inherent feeling of being a man any more than there is an inherent feeling of being a woman. You just *are*.

Women arent little versions of men and men arent bigger versions of women. Biology is complex and to deny this is ridiculous (not saying you are, but this seems to be a popular train of thought, i.e. thinking MtFs can get uterus transplants, or larping online about how gynecologists cant tell the different between a neo vagina or a real one). Theres evidence that because most medical testing is done on men that many medications will act different with women, how women need different dosages, and how some medical issues in women often go undiagnosed because we're all used to the classic 'male' symptoms. An example is how we all think heart attacks will start with shooting pain up the left arm, chest pain etc but it seems that women will have completely different symptoms and many heart attacks in women arent caught in time. 

That being said I have a hard time believing that trans have anything more than an extreme type of body dysphoria. I'm not gonna be an asshole and call someone trans their bio pronouns to their face (given they're otherwise nice and polite, if not, all bets are off), but in private? Probably gonna use the bio ones. Online? Yep. If someone wanted me to use anything other than she or he I would laugh in their face.  No one should lose their job and become an unperson for this.

Hope you enjoyed my rambling bullshit

I have to commend you for the edit at least.

I do agree with the post title though, people's sex/gender/whatever *is* completely irrelevant to me. For the most part, I don't care about this stuff. It's so irrelevant day-to-day. The whole "who should use what bathroom" thing was such a non-issue. Just let the business owners decide, like everything else that happens in their business, if you don't like their bathroom policy don't go there.

However, I'm not going to indulge people's delusions though when it comes to being wanting to be called "xir" or whatever.
